statement.p:
Let T: \R^n\to\R^m be a linear transformation with matrix A. Which of the following are equivalent to the statement that T is onto?
A has a pivot in each row.
The columns of A are linearly independent.
If T(v)=T(w) then v=w.
For each input v, T there is exactly one output T(v).

answer.p: 1 only. Options 2 and 3 are equivalent to T being one-to-one, and option 4 is true for any transformation.

statement.p:
Suppose T is a linear map.
If v_1,\ldots,v_k are dependent, why are T(v_1),\ldots,T(v_k) dependent?
If v_1,\ldots,v_k are independent, need T(v_1),\ldots,T(v_k) be independent?
If T(v_1),\ldots,T(v_k) are dependent, need v_1,\ldots,v_k be dependent?
If T(v_1),\ldots,T(v_k) are independent, why are v_1,\ldots,v_k are independent?
If T\colon\R^n\to\R^m is a linear map,and S is a subspace of \R^n, why is T(S) a subspace of \R^m?
How is the area of a region R in \R^2 related to the area of its image under the linear transformation A? Under A^2? Under A^{-3}?
